title.narrative: Togo - Multi-Country (Benin-Togo-Guinea) COVID-19 Response Support Programme
Togo - Programme multi-pays (Bénin- Togo- Guinée) d'appui à la réponse à la COVID-19

description.narrative: The proposed project is part of the COVID-19 Multi-Country Response Support Program (PAR-COVID-19) for a total amount of UA 49.1 million to the Republics of Togo, Benin and Guinea. The program was evaluated in April 2020, following requests from these countries to the Bank. All three countries recorded their first COVID-19 cases during the period 7-16 March 2020. As of 25 May, a total of 3,050 cases had tested positive in the three countries, including 1949 patients hospitalized and treated, 1,074 cured cases, and 27 deaths (representing an average case-fatality rate of 0.88%). The Program seeks to provide an emergency response to the health and socio-economic crisis caused by the COVID-19 pandemic in the three abovementioned countries which have many similarities. This is a Crisis Response Budget Support (CRBS) operation. The measures supported by the Program will be implemented over a 12-month period starting in June 2020 and will contribute to the achievement of the following outcomes: (i) strengthening of screening capacity; (ii) improvement of national coverage in patient isolation structures; and (iii) mitigation of the socio-economic effects of the health crisis. This intervention concerns the component of the program dedicated to Togo, the cost of which is estimated at UA 20 million.

Le présent projet s’inscrit dans le cadre du Programme multi-pays d’appui à la réponse à la COVID-19 (PAR-Covid-19) pour un montant total de 49,1millions d’UC en faveur des Républiques du Togo, du Bénin, et de Guinée. Le programme a été évalué en avril 2020, à la suite des demandes adressées par les pays à la Banque. Les trois pays ont enregistré leurs premiers cas de COVID-19 au cours de la période du 7 au 16 mars 2020.A la date du 25 mai, l’on dénombrait dans les trois pays, un total de 3,050 cas testés positifs, dont 1949 personnes malades hospitalisées et traitées, 1074personnes guéries, et 27 décès (soit un taux de létalité moyen de 0,88 %). Le Programme vise à apporter une réponse d’urgence à la crise sanitaire et socioéconomique induite par la pandémie de la COVID-19 dans les trois pays susmentionnés, qui présentent beaucoup de similitudes. Il s'agit d'une opération d’appui budgétaire en réponse à la crise (ABRC). Les mesures soutenues par le Programme seront mises en œuvre sur une période de 12 mois à partir de juin 2020 et contribueront à l’atteinte des résultats ci-après : (i) renforcement de la capacité de dépistage;(ii) amélioration de la couverture nationale en structures d’isolation des malades ; et (iii) atténuation des effets socioéconomiques de la crise sanitaire. La présente intervention concerne la composante du programme dédiée au Togo dont le coût est évalué à 20 millions d’UC.

PAR-COVID-19 seeks to help strengthen the health and socio-economic resilience of the three countries to the novel coronavirus pandemic. The supported reforms are aimed at strengthening the health response measures and efforts to mitigate the socio-economic impact of the pandemic. Although supporting urgent measures, the program thus prepares countries for more structuring reforms during the post-crisis period, in line with the pillars of ADF-15, namely improving the business environment and institutional capacity to build resilience.

Le PAR-COVID-19 vise à contribuer au renforcement de la résilience sanitaire et socioéconomique des trois pays à la pandémie du nouveau coronavirus. Les réformes soutenues visent à appuyer d’une part les mesures de riposte sanitaire et d’autre part les efforts d’atténuation des effets socioéconomiques de la pandémie. Bien que soutenant des mesures urgentes, le programme prépare ainsi les pays à des réformes plus structurantes au cours de la période post-crise, en ligne avec les piliers du FAD-15, à savoir l’amélioration de l'environnement des affaires et le renforcement des capacités humaines et institutionnelles pour renforcer la résilience.

PAR-COVID-19 will directly benefit the ministry in charge of the economy and finance by financing the national budget and will have an impact on all Togolese populations, the ultimate beneficiaries of budget of budget implementation. More specifically, all vulnerable groups such as low-income households in both urban and rural areas, as well as private sector businesses will benefit from the emergency measures supported by the program.

Le PAR-COVID-19 bénéficiera directement au ministère en charge de l’économie et des finances à travers le financement du budget national et impactera l’ensemble des populations togolaises, bénéficiaires ultimes de l’exécution du budget. Plus spécifiquement, toutes les couches vulnérables que sont les ménages à revenus faibles aussi bien en zone urbaine que rurale, ainsi que les entreprises du secteur privé bénéficieront des mesures d’urgence soutenues par le programme.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCES GOUVERNEMENT DU TOGO

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

receiver-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCES GOUVERNEMENT DU TOGO
MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCES GOUVERNEMENT DU TOGO
MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCES GOUVERNEMENT DU TOGO

title.narrative: National coverage of health structures for isolation of patients
Prevalence of households in moderate or severe food insecurity
Number of screening test laboratories operational in all the regions and districts
Additional treatment centres established in the other regions
A training plan for all laboratory technicians in COVID-19 diagnosis and biosafety issues is adopted

target.value: A training plan adopted and technicians trained

title.narrative: Number of most vulnerable social people benefiting from cash transfers
Number of most vulnerable social people benefiting from cash transfers - of which women
Number of households benefiting from the social tranche for electricity
The COVID-19 response strategy is adopted
The Decree establishing the Pandemic Coordination and Management Framework is adopted

target.value: A Decree establishing the Pandemic Coordination and Management Framework adopted

title.narrative: The Amended Finance Bill is adopted in a Cabinet Meeting
An Agricultural Response Plan, including agricultural input loans for the 2020/2021 season, is implemented

target.value: An implementation report is produced and the total amount of resources allocated is at least CFAF 96.7 billion

title.narrative: An Ordinance on the 25% special reduction on the tax instalment referred to in Article 118 of the General Tax Code (CGI) and Article 83 of the Tax Procedures Code (LPF) is adopted
The payment of tax instalments for businesses in sectors hard hit by the pandemic (transport, hotels, bars, restaurants, and entertainment and recreational activities) is deferred on request
Penalties for late submission of financial statements expected by 31 March 2020 for sole proprietorships and by 30 April 2020 for corporate businesses are deferred

The second single business tax (TPU) instalment referred to in Article 57 of the Tax Procedures Code (LPF) for single proprietorships, road hauliers, artisans and similar businesses subject to the TPU is reduced by 50%
The audit of public contracts awarded under the response to COVID-19 is conducted

target.value: An Audit Report available in June 2021
